## Multiparticipant Screen Sharing

In SAGE multiple people can share screen at the same time. To share the screen:

- Navigate to any blank space, right click, select "Screenshares", and click "Start Sharing"

![](images/screensharing.png){fig-align="center" width="800px" height="500px"}

- Next, select the screen you want to share and click share.

![](images/screensharing2.png){fig-align="center" width="800px" height="500px"}

## Following a User

In SAGE, you can follow pointer of a specific user. To do this:

- Right click on the screen, and select "Users"

![](images/users.png){fig-align="center" width="800px" height="500px"}

- Click the name of the user you want to follow, and select "Follow Them". Similarly to unfollow, click "Unfollow them".

![](images/following.png){fig-align="center" width="800px" height="500px"}

## Using Pens and Erasers

To use a pen:

- Right click on any blank space, and select "Annotations". You can write both on the screen and on the PDF.

![](images/write.png){fig-align="center" width="800px" height="500px"}

To erase:

- Right click on any blank space, and select "Eraser". To erase click on the writings.

![](images/erase.png){fig-align="center" width="800px" height="500px"}

## Python 3 Kernels

Python 3 kernels are directly incorporated into SAGE (however, other applications like R, and Stata are not available). To create a kernel:

- Right click on a blank space on the screen, select kernels and click "Create Kernel".

![](images/kernel1.png){fig-align="center" width="800px" height="500px"}

- Type the name of the kernel (spaces are not allowed). Then, click "Create".

![](images/kernel2.png){fig-align="center" width="800px" height="500px"}
